Dear Ms. Calcaterra:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Behavior management.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4157
Section (2) At a minimum, the behavior management system shall include
Description all of the following:
(b) Positive intervention strategies to assist residents in
developing improved problem solving, self-management,
and social skills.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff 1 threatened to spit on Youth A during an altercation.
Investigation The Complainant was interviewed on 07/03/2024 and no
additional information was provided.
Youth A was interviewed on 07/03/2024 during an unannounced,
face-to-face visit to the facility. He stated that he was in a kitchen
area with Staff 1 at the time of the incident. Youth A recalled
getting upset, but could not remember why, and that he was trying
to turn off a dishwashing machine. Youth A stated Staff 1
attempted to stop him from doing so. After arguing for a brief
period of time, Youth A stated Staff 1 and he left the kitchen and
entered the dining area. Youth A recalled Staff 1 spitting on him
at this point. Youth A confirmed he spit on Staff 1 prior to this and
was throwing things at the time. Youth A believed there was a
female staff member who would have witnessed Staff 1 spitting on
him, but he could not remember who that was. Youth A stated
Staff 1 then left the dining area and he had not seen him at the
facility since then.
Staff 2 was interviewed over the phone on 07/26/2024. She
recalled the incident in question. Staff 2 stated she met Staff 1
and Youth A in the kitchen and discovered Youth A was escalating
more and more. She stated Youth A was trying to turn off the
dishwashing machine and Staff 1 was trying to stop him. Staff 2
did not believe Staff 1 touched Youth A at that time, other than
incidental contact. Staff 2 recalled following both individuals out of
the kitchen area to the dining area. Staff 2 stated Youth A was
attempting to throw items and Staff 1 stated to him “Hit me, let the
camera see you do it.” Staff 2 recalled Youth A faking a spitting
motion towards Staff 1, and then Staff 1 pushing Youth A
2

backwards. Staff 2 believed Youth A then actually spit at Staff 1,
and then Staff 1 spit back at Youth A. At that point Staff 1 was
near the exit door of the dining area, and Staff 2 asked him to
leave so that she could continue to de-escalate Youth A. Staff 2
recalled Staff 1 stating “He’s yours now” and then leaving.
Staff 1 was interviewed on 07/26/2024 over the phone. He stated
he was paired with Youth A for a portion of the day where the
incident occurred. He recalled going to the kitchen with Youth A
because he had requested a snack. Once they were in the
kitchen Youth A began to show signs of defiance and escalation,
including attempting to turn on and off kitchen appliances. As this
occurred Youth A grabbed Staff 1 on the arm and stated, “What
are you gonna do about it?” Youth A then attempted to spit on
Staff 1. Staff 1 recalled seeing Staff 2 then come into the kitchen.
Youth A continued to attempt to spit at Staff 1, and Staff 1 recalled
stating “If you spit at me, I am going to spit at you.” Staff 1
clarified this occurred in the dining area next to the kitchen. Staff
1 then stated he did spit at Youth A, but only for effect and aimed
at the ground near Youth A’s feet. Staff 1 recalled Youth A
throwing things at him and using racial slurs towards him. Staff 1
stated he then removed himself from the dining area because
Youth A was with Staff 2 at this point.
Video reviewed:
• Two video clips of the incident were provided. The first
began at 8:53pm on 06/29/2024. Youth A and Staff 1 were
in the kitchen area and Youth A began to try to turn off the
dishwashing machine as it was running. Staff 1 held his
hands in front of the machine and attempted to not allow
Youth A to do so. Staff 1 was then able to move in
between Youth A and the machine. Staff 1 could be seen
holding his hands up and attempting to verbally de-escalate
Youth A when Staff 2 entered the kitchen. At 8:54:52pm
Youth A was seen attempting to spit on Staff 1 over the
shoulder of Staff 2. Staff 1 pushed Youth A back with his
left hand and moved toward the exit of the kitchen. Staff 1
then exited the kitchen, followed by Youth A and Staff 2.
• A separate bird’s eye camera view of the dining area
showed Staff 1 and then Youth A and Staff 2 entering at
8:55pm. Staff 1 was near the exit door of the dining area
when Youth A approached him with Staff 2 following
behind. From a few feet away Staff 1 could be seen
making a spitting motion towards Youth A. Youth A then
made the same motion back towards Staff 1. Youth A then
escalated further and threw items in the direction of Staff 1.
3

Documents reviewed:
• Staff 1 had no discipline in his personnel file at the time of
the incident in question. He had completed his most recent
behavior management training in February 2024.
• An incident report dated 06/29/2024 was provided and had
consistent details with the interviews in this investigation.
• Facility administration confirmed that Staff 1 was placed on
administrative leave after the incident occurred on
06/29/2024 and his employment was terminated as of
07/31/2024.
• Facility policy regarding behavior management was
received and reviewed. It stated that youth will have
behavior management plans designed that include
“strength-based, non-coercive crisis prevention and
intervention strategies that are trauma responsive and best
practice.”
Analysis The agency is found in non-compliance as per staff and youth
interviews and video review, Staff 1 spit at Youth A during an
incident on 06/29/2024.
Conclusion VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited
to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Staff 1 pushed Youth A during an altercation.
Investigation Staff 2 was interviewed over the phone on 07/26/2024. Staff 2
stated Youth A was attempting to throw items and Staff 1 stated to
him “Hit me, let the camera see you do it.” Staff 2 recalled Youth
4

A faking a spitting motion towards Staff 1, and then Staff 1
pushing Youth A backwards.
Video reviewed:
• In the video clips of the incident that occurred on
06/29/2024, Staff 1 could be seen pushing Youth A two
separate times. Both instances occurred while they were in
the kitchen and both involved Staff 2 standing in between
Staff 1 and Youth A attempting to intervene. The first
instance occurred after it appeared that Youth A spit at
Staff 1, and in response Staff 1 reached past Staff 2 and
used his left hand to push Youth A in the right shoulder.
Youth A took a step backwards as a result. Staff 1 then
moved toward the exit door of the kitchen. With Staff 2 still
positioned in between he and Youth A, Staff 1 used his left
hand to push Youth A in the left shoulder as he exited the
kitchen. Youth A then took a step backwards and
appeared to spit towards Staff 1 through the doorway.
Documents reviewed:
• Facility policy regarding prohibited interventions was
received and reviewed. It stated that any kind of physical
punishment was prohibited for staff intervening with youth,
including pushing.
Analysis The agency is found in non-compliance as per staff interviews and
video review, Staff 1 pushed Youth A two times during an incident
on 06/29/2024.
Conclusion VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
5

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
